conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are the yellow and blue structures that guide the flow of the liquid.
The liquid flows from A, B, and C and needs to be directed into either D or E.
The yellow liquid flows through the yellow baffle and is directed towards container D.
The blue liquid flows through the blue baffle and is directed towards container E.
The orange liquid flows through the orange baffle and is directed towards container D.
The yellow and orange liquids both flow into container D.
The blue liquid flows into container E.
Yellow and orange liquids will flow into container D; blue liquid will flow into container E.
